lines.text: Tell me, is Saint Christopher as good a player as they say he is?
He is good, but too serious
and not very talkative.
Talk? Oh, if it is talk you want, come with me Redstone
[Essex is passing as Redstone]
; I know a place. We can have drinks, and talk...
...and talk about life.
The only thing I've seen is death, or the prospect of it.
But that's what makes life worthwhile; every time you cheat death, you feel the pure thrill of life
And that is what my job is; that is why I'm so content in this frozen world.
Tell me, exactly what is your job?

to keep the game alive. The game is all that's important. The only intelligent expression left is the game of Quintet. All the elements of life are contained in it; our art, our philosophy, all things of value fit the game. The game is the only thing of value
I find you despicable. I despise your arrogance.
It is as planned.
It's not common for people to smile.
Hope is an obsolete word.

[Passing a motionless body]
Shouldn't we help him? He's going to freeze to death.

[Examining the body]
He already has.
Trying to find a meaning where there is none? Death is arbitrary.
You'll never understand the scheme until you're part of the scheme.
Are you telling me I will be?
Yes, at the exact moment it will be too late.
